content.p: Before writing code, programmers need a workspace where they can type, run, and test their programs. This workspace is called a development environment.
Choosing the right tools helps you write better code, faster.
A text editor is where you write and edit code. It should highlight syntax, help you navigate files, and optionally suggest corrections.

ul.li: VS Code: Popular, fast, and extensible
Sublime Text: Lightweight with powerful features

content.p: The console is where your program outputs text. The terminal is where you run and test your code.

ul.li: Console shows what your code prints.
Terminal lets you interact with the system.

When coding for the web, your browser is your testing ground. Use developer tools to inspect your code and debug errors.

ul.li: Use a reliable text editor to write code efficiently.
Understand how to use the terminal and console to run and test code.
Choose a browser with good developer tools for web projects.

summary.p: Your development environment is your programming toolkit. Set it up right to code with confidence.
